content.text:
# Gurudwara Jand Sahib

| architecture          = yes
| specifications        =
}}
Gurdwara Jand Sahib is a Sikh gurdwara located in village Jand Sahib of Faridkot district in Punjab, India. The pin code of the place is 151212, located 23 km west of the Faridkot City.
History
Guru Gobind Singh ji stayed night on this place while his way from Sri Muktsar Sahib to Bazidpur, Ferozepur. One of the berries tree under which Guru Gobind singh stayed is still standing today and the Jand tree (Botanical name: Prosopis cineraria) of the fort to which the horse was tied is still standing today. The Gurdwara Sahib was built at this place by the Faridkot princely state.
